comment.text:
I'd give it 4.5 but Yelp won't let me. 
This out school Italian place rocks. Clams Casino, fried mozzarella (insane) grilled ceaser salad and linguine with shrimp & scallops in saffron sauce all friggin yummy.

We where excited to have our valentine dinner here BUT we were very very disappointed the whole restaurant has changed and not for the better.our food was  not amazing like it used to be. the ad on their website was NOT what it was supposed to be.It was to late to go somewhere else,so we ate here and cost was outrageous won't be going back anytime soon so sorry it was our favorite restaurant.

This was our first time at Nino's!! We made a reservation because we came on New Years eve. I would recommend making a reservation if you are coming with a large group since it is small and tight in the inside. 
The food and service were both amazing. We ordered a bottle of wine to share for the table. The bread was also very fresh. I ordered the capellini Elena which shrimp, spinach, in a cream sauce. The most fresh and authentic pasta I have had at any restaurant before bar none! I will definitely come back here to dine.

Nino's is a classic choice for some great tasting Italian food! I came for my junior prom many years ago and it was just as good!!! We got a reservation for a New Year's Eve and had to wait a couple minutes for our table to be ready. Upon being seated, we got a basket of bread from our waiter (every additional basket is $2.50 but you don't need it!! The apps and portions are worth it)

To drink we got a bottle of red wine which was great and our waiter poured for us. To start we got the calamari which deliciously and not overly breaded or fried which made it great. For the main, I got the fettuccine all√° Michaela and split a Caesar salad. Next time, I would do a half portion of pasta with a a full salad bc the salad was great and the pasta is great but it's nice to get the best of both worlds for the same price!! We all enjoyed our dishes and loved mine. The seafood was great and the portions were generous. Wait staff was awesome and the vibes are great. Would go again!

Excellent. Just excellent Italian food. It's a perfect date night spot- especially out on the patio- the calamari rocks, the bread is flipping wonderful!!! Perfect ciabatta! And the wine is great- super vast list. The pasta is amazing- classic Alfredo rocks and the Pasta Al a michella is my total favorite. The service is impeccable. Like I'm pretty sure some of the servers have been at this location since it began they are so knowledgeable and anticipate your needs so well. I miss living closer to it because it is such a lovely date night spot! Check it out and order extra bread!

Wow! Amazing food, customer service was great, Nina was my bar tender and she suggested the Eva Pasta and crazy good, people kept asking me what I ordered. It wasn't too heavy but was flavorful and filling. And a plus is that she was really nice and knowledgeable. I know they just opened but if they keep this up, this will be the go to Italian vibe in ATL!!
Best veal scallopini in Atlanta. Professional waitstaff. Very well run family establishment that's an Atlanta classic!

Ninos is great. Stellar service old Fashioned service old-school Italian menu old-school Italian kitchen call for reservations. The indoor dining has a better experience than the outdoor dining. Unless of course that's what you prefer. Try the eggplant try the veal and of course simply the pasta and Pomodoro this is my favorite Italian spot. At times you might feel like you're on the set of the Sopranos!

Great place for a date night! Got seated in the covered patio, which ended up being a lot better than indoors. The sun going down and the hanging lights set the mood and I preferred it over the dark setting indoors.

You start out with a piece of bruschetta (1 per person) and a basket of bread ($2.50 extra per basket if you want more bread). My favorite part is always the bread haha.

Haven't had lasagna in forever and it did not disappoint. The waiter said he liked the homemade bolognese sauce, and I'm glad I listened to him. It was delicious! My husband ordered the fettuccine alla michela and he really enjoyed it (he can be very picky about pasta). I wasn't a fan of the sauce but the shrimp and scallops were perfectly cooked. There were a lot more shrimp and scallops than the pasta itself, which is pretty unusual, so it could be a smaller portion for some. My husband and I don't have that big of a stomach so it was a perfect amount (but we also did fill our stomachs with the bread).

Nino's is absolutely a win every time. Whatever you order will be 




           
Caesar Salad
Orecchiette Con Salsicce E Rapini

We stumbled upon Nino's on a Friday night. Hubby was craving Italian and we hopped on Yelp and found this nearby. We arrived just as they were opening. The parking lot is small and therefore they have Valet parking only. As we entered a lot of the serving staff were standing near the door in the bar area and everyone was smiling. Good sign in our opinion - staff are happy. Our server, Aniya, was very friendly and attentive. We ordered mussels as our appetizer and they were wonderful. Our meals, Peperoncini Eva and Lasagna, were very tasty. The shrimp in hubby's dish were well sauteed and took on the garlic wine sauce very well but were a little over cooked which surprised us. The marinara sauce used with the lasagna was bright and fresh and quite yummy - wish there was just a little more of it. For dessert we had the Italian cheesecake. We enjoyed our impromptu date night.

I feel like this restaurant is for the older crowd. The food is bland and tasteless but it seems that people like it regardless. I like my Italian food to pop with flavor and this just wasn't it. The service was slow, but they environment called for it. I was hoping this was going to be my next favorite spot because I love Italian food. For me it's a no oh definitely in the hell is missing out on the bright end, delicious flavors of Italy. It was almost like it was diluted..

Absolutely wonderful experience!! Chose to go here for my birthday dinner and it was totally worth it! Aliya was very informative and friendly and the rest of the staff was great as well. Cute decor and very cozy. All of our food was delicious. The calamari was amazing and I loved my fettuccine. Perfect portion and the seafood was delicious. My parents shared the almond tort with ice cream and I got a complimentary tiramisu that was outstanding. We will definitely be back!

Parking is a disaster... losing business to other restaurants that don't MAKE you pay to park...
It's a shame cause the food was top notch...

Every time my company comes to Atlanta for business, we seriously form our plans (and AirBnB's) around proximity to Nino's Italian Restaurant. Their food & service are always top notch! The prices are perfectly matched to the quality & quantity of food you get, and EVERY menu option has been a home run. Every. Time. 
Nino's, thank you for always accommodating our group (& supplying our Boss with bottles of Prisoner vino)! Please don't ever change. See you again this summer!

Visited Nino's for a special occasion and they did not disappoint. This is an authentic gym in Atlanta that has good service, good atmosphere, & good food. I will be back & look forward to visiting in a regular basis and trying different dishes. Bravo.

The food service an ambiance or second to none!! Nino's never disappoints!!  if you're in Atlanta and I never been to Nino 's this will be a real treat!  Whether you're on a date or with a group of people, you will always be treated like they've known you forever.  The best lasagna in the city, and a friend of mine claims that the eggplant Parmesan is the best in the country. Enjoy and make sure you go to this wonderful gem.

First and foremost, the food was fantastic. I want to put that up front. Calamari Fritti, Insalata della Casa, Fettucine All√° Michela, and the special pasta of the day, which was described as a rotini and shrimp in a lemon garlic oil sauce. 

Yes, it's Valet parking, which is $5.  We had a birthday dinner reservation. We were a little early and waited at the bar for our table. Lovely glass of montepulciano and an old fashioned, reasonably priced. The decor is traditional Italian rustic, dimly lit, nicely decorated. All tables were full. 

2 couples were seated before us after our reservation time, both in corner booths. We were seated at the table by the wait station so had a steady flow of waitstaff by the table the whole night. Okay, fine, it happens. We'll live. Waiter comes to the table with water, very pleasant. 

The calamari was really good, and the fra di√°volo sauce was excellent. Then we split a house salad, a Gorgonzola and walnut, which had very delicious greens. Then we ordered the Fettucine All√° Michela and the pasta special. 

The scallops in the Fettucine dish were excellent. Tender, flavorful, and very tasty. The special of the day, which we asked twice for a description, was rotini with shrimp and a garlic sauce. I got a plate of shrimp served on...capellini. Told the food runner we ordered the special, and he assured us it was the special. We called the waiter over and he was not concerned in the least - he just kind of blinked at me for a minute. WTF. He then said he never said rotini, he said rigatoni. I said this is not rigatoni either. I had tasted it and it was delicious, so I just said I would eat it so my date's food didn't get cold. We did inform the maitre d that it happened. Fortunate accident because that was some of the best shrimp and lemon capellini I've had in my life. For dessert the waiter recommended the chocolate mousse cake and it was also very delicious. The food was top notch start to finish.  

If you made it this far, now comes the surreal part: I pulled my phone out and got a picture of rigatoni and when the waiter came by, I showed him the picture, said this is rigatoni, and my dish is capellini. He just blinked, gestured at my plate, and said yes, it's rigatoni. At that point I was speechless. I have no idea what that was.
the chicken parm and fettuccine alfredo are to die for! I typically order delivery and it is always hot and delicious. The portions are generous and the tiramisu is AMAZING!! do not skip dessert

What an amazing and warm space this restaurant provides. Dining at Nino's felt like joining a friend in their kitchen for dinner. Sasha was our waiter and he was very kind. 

My girlfriend and I visited Nino's for a date night on a Saturday. Although the parking lot was packed, we did not have to wait to be seated. We both ordered the Fettuccine Alla Michela. I had it regularly and my girlfriend ordered hers without scallops and extra shrimp. It was fantastic. The saffron cream sauce placed a twist on the traditional fettuccine experience. It was a little sweet and blended with the seared scallops and shrimp perfectly. The fresh made pasta was absolutely delicious. 

We also enjoyed a bottle of wine and some calamari as an appetizer. The calamari was very fresh but it was lightly battered and not as crispy as we would have liked. It was almost too chewy. 

Other than that, we'd certainly visit again and explore other things on the menu.

photos.caption: FETTUCCINE ALLA MICHELA (no scallops and extra shrimp)

comment.text:
I had to stay in Stone Mountain and struggled with food. I had the driest falafel and grease dripping air fried vegan food and bland curry so I was just hoping for something edible. Instead I was blessed with one of the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had that wasn't my own cooking. I have never eaten a full plate at an Italian restaurant until Ninos. 

Ninos is a 2nd generation family owned Italian restaurant. If you want a local wonderful family owned place, go here. Even the complimentary bread was divine. 

For the record, The next night I also had spaghetti and meatballs at a highly rated place in NYC with my hotel and it wasn't nearly as good.

One trip, a consensus isn't possible, but I won't go back. 
When you pay $27 for some fettuccine with shrimp and scallops, you shouldn't get overcooked seafood on the dish. It just isn't that difficult to prepare the items that make the dish what it should be. 
There's no excuse for tough, dry shrimp and scallops. Very disappointing.
This is one of the best Italian Restaurants remaining in Atlanta.  Excellent service and always great for a date or just a night out with friends.

The food was "off the chain!" The veal Gorgonzola with angel hair pasta with extra garlic! The waiter(Sasha) was on point in every way! They are back!! Covid might have slowed them down(as it did everyone) but cookin now!!!!

Came in for a late night dinner !! 5 stars !!! The food was amazing 10/10 wow I'm impressed very shocked ! Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection ! The owner and his son greeted me at the door they were very nice and kind. Definitely will be back to Ninos

Ok is an accurate description. Brought the 7 of us. A couple chicken parms, some seafood pastas, rigatoni, veal goranzola. We found the food to be under seasoned. The cream in the cream sauces was not cooked down - tasted raw right out of the carton.  My canoli  was empty in the middle.  Overall not a place I would go back to and spend $600 again....

We had a terrific dinner here!  Nino's has a cozy, old school ambience and they make you feel welcome right off the bat.  The food was excellent.  I liked the Caesar Salad, and the Pappardelle Verde and the Vitello Piccata are highly recommended. Drinks are solid and the wine list is well selected and reasonably priced.  You'll love the staff.  They are very attentive and friendly.  Convenient valet parking.  I'll definitely be coming back!!

Don't eat hear... you are better off going to Olive Garden

Worst experience ever. 2 hour wait for food, Luke warm food, wait staff including manager not inviting at all!! 

Overpriced food and small portion sizes. 

The manager was eating with some other people, turns music up incredibly loud and has the worst attitude!!
Quite good Italian food here. Small simple restaurant with impressive taste and quality. Delicious. Good and friendly service.

Still an Atlanta institution. I'm always worth coming here. The first time I sat inside, didn't care for it much. The table that we were set it at was one by the kitchen and secondly right in front of a huge blower. I don't know about you but chemotherapy makes me mostly cold and then hot. Glad I brought my pashmina! I'm server was kind into the point. Hopeful and deciding between two pasta dishes. I think he made a great suggestion. Knowing that I only have about 70% of my taste buds I have to say that my supper was delicious, my Malbac was tasty it complemented it well, and the company was lovely! Looking forward to coming back when I have full flavor at my disposal and hopefully get a seat outside.

Peperoncino Eva - Red pepper infused spaghetti, saut√©ed shrimp, roasted artichokes, garlic and olive oil sauce.

That is ALL you need to know. Order that and you will be happy.

3 of us went on a Friday night around 7:30 and were seated right away...because we had reservations. I definitely encourage everyone to make reservations because this place gets packed for the dinner rush.

One of my friends ordered the fettuccine alfredo and the other ordered Torchietti Vodka. Let me just tell you...unless you're a basic bish...do NOT order the alfredo at a fancy restaurant. It's like the annoying kid that your mom told you to be nice to and play with but no one wants around. It definitely tasted that way here. I mean, they have their Fettucine Alla Michela which probably tasted 100 times better, but noooo she ordered that nonsense. She tried it, I tried it, my other friend tried it and we all hated it and they were gracious enough to swap it out for the Eva AND comped it on top of that.

The Torchietti Vodka was really really good and so was my Eva. 
I think I'm going to name my future daughter that. Yes...after this pasta dish hahaha!

Friendly and attentive staff and great ambience...not too brightly lit. Perfect for slurping up pasta without feeling watched.

I will definitely be back the next time I'm in ATL!
Amazing restaurant with great food, ambiance and wait staff. Thanks for a wonderful evening. Looking forward to going back

Covid Central with no mask policy. Despite what I read on the website about wearing masks going to your table, people were walking in and out unmasked. When I mentioned it to a host on the way out, I got a surly  'We don't require masks'.
Cramped and dumpy. Had a $22.00 mediocre eggplant parmigiana. ( is that what other reviewers mean by 'old school')?  Uncomfortably heavy, overcooked, largely tasteless food.
Wait staff brought a Jack and coke instead of the ordered Diet Coke ( I don't drink alcohol due to a medication I am on). Took a hefty swallow and realized it had Jack. 
Recommended to the  easily pleased.
Nice to revisit an old favorite and see it is still as good has always. Food was great. Service (Mark) excellent as ever. Won't wait as long until the next time there.

Hum. What to say. Service off. Not sure why. They take mostly reservations.  Took forever to get food and it was cold but tasty. Bread service ridiculous. $2.50 for a piece of bread. Soup had no flavor. Pasta ok. I'll try again but average experience tonight.

Food is always delicious and full of flavor. The lasagna is robust, the spaghetti and meatballs is great if you're REALLY hungry and the calamari always has just enough salt to balance the lemon squeeze. This place has a true authenticity about it. From the decor to the savory feeling after you're through with your meal, it's no wonder why this place has continued to thrive! It's one of the best Italian restaurants in Atlanta.

Nino's never ceases to please. Tony and Helen welcomed us back after 23 years away, and we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. I can't think of any better place to enjoy an evening in Atlanta!

- Brad Littlefield, La Vista Park
One of my favorites for classic Italian. We have to drive a little further than I usual local spots but really worth it.

This place has been here for years and I finally had the chance to go for a private event (not that I couldn't go other times).  The place is small and very old school. 

We had the calamari and stuffed mushroom appetizers. The mushrooms were very good. I also had the veal parmigiana, which reminded me of my moms home cooking.  The food and service were really good.

I've been living in Georgia since 4/20. Have been in Atlanta since March. Found a NY style Italian restaurant here. Very authentic food. Nice dim ambiance and soft music playing. We had Silvio, a seasoned Italian waiter and really enjoyed our first time here. The food and drinks were upscale and we will be back!

First time at Nino's and I enjoyed the experience. I ordered the Torchietti Alla Vodka & added chicken. My bf ordered the Capellini Elena. Both pastas were so delicious with the different sauces. My dish was a little bigger than his so of course he ate some of mine, lol. Every employee in the restaurant was so attentive.

photos.caption: TORCHIETTI ALLA VODKA (added chicken) & Capellini Elena

comment.text:
Meh. Was craving some authentic italian pasta, something saucy and rich so I decided to try Nino's. The atmosphere was nice. Dark lighting, candles, etc. Our waiter was an elderly Italian guy that gave the bare minimum service-wise. I ordered a calamari and before I could even ask for a glass of Pinot Grigio he had already left the table without saying a word. Weird.

Anyway, the calamari was unseasoned. It had a nice breading but lacked flavor overall. I NEVER add salt to my food, and the fact that I had to add salt and pepper to this calamari was telling. The Caesar salads were pretty tasty. It was actually my favorite part of the meal.

I played it safe by trying the chicken parmigiana for my entree. This was also...unseasoned. Also it tasted as if my cutlet had been fried in old grease. So in addition to an overall lack of flavor, it had this dirty greasy aftertaste that was just unappetizing. I ate maybe two or three bites and didn't want anymore. I heard that Italians are known for under seasoning food, relying on garlic, herbs, and fresh vegetables to give food flavor. I'd be ok with this if my dish incorporated all those elements, but it really just fell flat.

Between the mediocre food and crappy service, I'm in no rush to return anytime soon. Thanks but no thanks, Nino's.

Pretty overpriced for what you get. 
The food isn't bad per day but you can get Italian for a better price that tastes better.

Overpriced and tacky! Rude man when entering was so bothered to have to do his job! Tiny portions. If you ask for any variation of common items, they stick it to you with a hefty price for each item. I could dump a bag of frozen vegetables on top of some angel hair with more flavor for a 1/70th of the cost!

This was our first time here, and the food was delicious! We started off with the Insalata Della Casa, which was a great refreshing mix of flavors. I had the Chicken Parmesean which was ok, but not the greatest. It had too much sauce which took away from the entree. My boyfriend had the Torchietti Gabriela and it was delicious, the mozzarella was extremely fresh! The atmosphere was pleasant and service was great. Would highly recommend!

Delicious! Classic, old school Italian. 

The food came out quickly. We came at 6:15 on Sunday and had our food 15 minutes after ordering. They do modifications to the menu, like if you want a different sauce.

photos.caption: Pasta with eggplant and tomatoes and mozerella

comment.text: I absolutely love this place. This is going to be my new go to for birthdays. I was treated amazingly and the food was superb. Would totally visit again.

I visited Nino's on a Tuesday Night at around 9:30PM. Nino's at this time is a quiet, calm, and quaint Italian restaurant with a beautiful 7 to
8 seat bar. The restaurant also has a cute small eating section, a real Italian feel. The lighting is very romantic and PERFECT for dates. Ladies, if you have small mistakes in your makeup, this place will make you feel comfortable, because the lights are dim enough. It's has a sexy feel. You can also bring your own bottles of wine for an up charge of $25 per bottle. This restaurant is slightly on the upscale side, so expect for plates to range  from 18 to 30ish dollars. Everything is worth it at this time and location. I'm not sure how the place is on the weekends. Reservations can be made which is awesome. The staff was also friendly, inviting, and knowledgeable.
Awesone food and service!! Words can't describe. It's a step back in time but the food has been keeping up!   Excellent!!

Honestly best Italian I had in a long while. It was a last minute find via yelp. Don't regret at all. Reminds me of family Italian retuarant in ny. My neices wanted Alfredo which they don't have on the menu, and they whipped it up for them without an issue. I'll definitely be back for some authentic Italian food. Every dish we ordered was delicious, staff was great too. Mature experienced staff was pleasant.
